intro: Bartsia euphrasioides, commonly known as the yellow marsh plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wet meadows. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in whorls along the stems. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture.
